item.title: The Fourfold Task
item.description: The four observations on Sidarta Gautama’s first teachings are usually stated in today’s language as: Existence is suffering The origin of suffering is craving The ceasing of suffering is the ceasing of craving The way to the ceasing of craving is the noble eightfold path This contemplation gives birth to four efforts, phrased in modern terms with Steven Bachelor’s lenses(1)(2): Suffering is to be fully known What arises is to be let go of The ceasing is to be beheld The way is to be cultivated These efforts arouse the Tiantai Bodhisattva vows, phrased using Robert F.
